website_summaries.verdict: Works well for dogs with sensitive stomachs, though not all of them like the mint flavoring added to mask the fishy smell.
pros: Fish oil works well to improve dogs’ fur and skin, and ease arthritic joints
Dogs with sensitive stomachs tolerate the capsules well
Mint flavoring keeps dogs’ breath fresh
cons: Gel capsules aren’t agreeable to many dogs, and some owners think they’re too large to give as pills
(They can be punctured and squeezed onto food, though.)
Can start sticking together after bottle is opened

customer_reviews.title: Welactin Gel Caps
customer_reviews.text: My Vet recommended this product and it is okay--has a peppermint oil to cover the fish oil smell, but I was a little disappointed in the amount of Omega3s, EPAs and DHAs versus straight Alaskan salmon oil--which is cheaper. The label does say the Welactin Liquid had more Omega 3s than the capsules, but the product information of the liquid does not say how much more, except it is more than twice the cost of the salmon oil. I had to prick open and squeeze the capsules on my dog's food, because she didn't like the consitency of chewing the gel cap. So I will be looking for a liquid with a pump in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Pam H

customer_reviews.title: Vet Recommended for Older Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Our vet carries these softgels, but we decided to "refill" ours through Amazon. Our 12-year-old cocker spaniel has trouble getting up the stairs in his older age, and this supplement has nutrients to improve his joint movement and (slightly) reduce pain. After a few months on Welactin, he started jumping up on the bed again. Fast forward a year later, Welactin still helps, but our dog has slowly started to experience pain from movement again.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri N.

customer_reviews.title: Very large capsules too cumbersome to give to dogs
customer_reviews.text: Huge size capsules. Too big for small dogs and because they were flavored with Peppermint I found that my dogs refused to eat food when I tried opening capsules and squirting contents on food. I had hoped this would be a good product to give my two elderly dogs as the ingredients sounded good but the size just made them not practice. Couldn't even fit them into a larger Pill Pocket
customer_reviews.author: E. Constable

customer_reviews.title: Good product but...
customer_reviews.text: Good product but my 2 doggies who are used to taking fish oil and love it unfortunately do not like the smell and taste of these. Not even if mixed with food. To me they do smell kind of strong and sort of rosemary like. My mom also purchased it for her dog and some like it and others don’t. We use other Nutramax products and like them but going to have to get our fish oil somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: MAlvarado

customer_reviews.title: Trusted and Vet Recommended Source for Omega 3's
customer_reviews.text: Vet recommended. Minty fresh. Pup likes her "weird chewy treat" (although it took a bit of getting used to)! Ingredients are quality. Nutramax is a trusted and respected producer of quality pet supplements. The science on the benefits of Omega 3's is established (brain health, coat condition, and anti-inflammatory properties), and Welactin is a suplement that you can give your pup without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: OC Goodgirl

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for our Staffie!
customer_reviews.text: We have an American Staffordshire Terrier who is very allergy-prone. He has previously taken other omega supplements that have improved his skin/coat, but this one hasn't done anything for him. Our vet said to give everything a month, and he's been taking it for 6 weeks, so that's a long enough trial. Returning the other bottles I bought and going back to his previous, more expensive supplement. Would have been a great value if it worked... oh well!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: My English bulldog is like a puppy!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old English Bulldog started shedding like crazy. Not just a little, A LOT. He was also scratching so much he was developing hot spots. My neighbor swears by these supplements for her Golden so I thought I would give it a try. I started giving him 3 capsules a day after dinner. They are a little large, even for him so I usually dunk them in water and he doesn't have an issue getting them down. Since taking these, he has had a significant reduction in shedding, he is scratching less, and is not licking his paws as much. He also seems more lively and puppy like. 100%recommend.
customer_reviews.author: lisa bradley

customer_reviews.title: Not for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: Product says for dogs of all sizes, but there is no way my 8lb chihuhua is going to swallow this pill. It's as big as his nose. I tried poking it and drizzling his food, as the directions recommend, but it smells like mint so he's hesitant to eat it. I'm better off giving him the fishy smelling drops which at least smell of protein. I would not recommend for dogs under 20lbs.
customer_reviews.author: ruben

customer_reviews.title: My dog pierced them and spits them out.
customer_reviews.text: These are very large to swallow while for a dog. Yes I’m familiar with just putting a big pill in the back of their mouth and the dog will swallow it by reflex - a method fine for the occasional temporary medicine. I can cut these open and put it on my dog’s food, but that is excessive considering you can get this in liquid form for humans. I also don’t want to put the pull in cream cheese or peanut butter and give a daily dose of gassy peanut butter or cheese. My dog gets yogurt every day but that’s enough.
customer_reviews.author: Fakespot User

customer_reviews.title: Pills work
customer_reviews.text: I had a bottle of this and the dog would not eat his food with the Welactin oil on his food. I then purchased these capsules and I can wrap them up with lunch meat to get him to take the pill. I can't say they have helped much, maybe a little and will continue for another month.
customer_reviews.author: Reg Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad taste. Good results.
customer_reviews.text: My dog hates the flavor. Have to hide them in her food and sometimes slather them in peanut butter to get her to eat them. But they really seem to help her skin. She has lupus, which results in a cracked and dry nose and some hyperkeratosis on her paw pads. We use these vitamins in addition to nose and paw butter for her. Keeps the dry flakes away and keeps her from licking her paws.
customer_reviews.author: Makenna Wingo

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my dog's skin and fur health and even her breath!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my puppy! She has sensitive skin and some puppy dandruff and the vet recommended Welactin. After only two days day her dandruff was gone and her coat was glossy and so healthy looking! I give it to her once a day now (which I find is plenty enough despite the box recommending twice a day. It also saves money!) to keep her skin moisturized and her fur thick and healthy. Her breath even stays fresher than my other dog's. I will continue to use this as a daily supplement and keep it on a 4 month subscription which is perfect and inexpensive!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice for a small dog.
customer_reviews.text: These softgels are HUGE. My 10.8 pound Maltese has congestive heart failure. When his cardiologist recommended a fish oil supplement, I read a lot of reviews. Welactin came highly recommended. I ordered these softgels thinking they would be another supplement I could easily add to his regimen. Unfortunately, these are enormous. They are way too large for him to take. It’s a nuisance snipping the end and squeezing the gel onto his food (which he half the time snubs because it must not smell/taste great). I would recommend the liquid or another brand if you have a smaller dog. I wish I had known the size of the capsule prior to ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Laura E Langford

customer_reviews.title: and he looks 100% better. I'd prefer a version was made for small/toy ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on the advice of a vet. I recently adopted a rescue Chihuahua who was very skinny, with lots of bald spots, a hairless tail, and a dry coat. After two weeks, most of the bald spots have filled in, his tail has hair, and he looks 100% better. I'd prefer a version was made for small/toy breeds since the capsules are quite large. (When it's covered with cream cheese, he gobbles it down. He didn't like the taste when I pierced the capsule and spread the oil on his food.)
customer_reviews.author: Aafje

customer_reviews.title: As described but my dog won't take these
customer_reviews.text: Our vet prescribed this brand to help our dog's skin and fur following a yeast infection. I was really glad to find this here at a much better price than the vet's pharmacy. We've tried to get the dog to take these for several days thinking stinky fish oil should be appealing. He's having none of it. I looked more closely at the packaging and see that this is mint flavored to avoid fishy dog breath. I suspect the mint is the reason for the refusal. Product is as advertised, Shipping was fast. Product was appropriately packaged and the bottle was sealed. My dog just won't take these pills.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: It really helped!
customer_reviews.text: My vet gave a number of recommendations for my little Bichon for arthritis. I decided to try Welactin and noticed a difference within a week. Sylvie was able to move easier and walk farther. I coat the capsule with a little cream cheese to encourage her to eat it. I am very pleased. So I did not rate the features because I have no idea how the capsule tastes or smells to my dog--there is no scent that I can smell. As for flavor, Sylvie swallows it whole. As to value for the money, priceless to have my dog more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: My vet recommended that I start giving these to my dogs who ...
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended that I start giving these to my dogs who have allergies which causes their skin to flake. These work great! A few weeks after starting them we could notice a difference and now that it's been a few months they are flake free! It's made such a difference to their skin. I would highly recommend these to anyone looking to help their dogs dry/flaky skin!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is minty!
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this product before and never had an issue. My dog always ate them. However this time I apparently purchased the minty flavor and he will not eat the capsules. He is not a picky dog so this is pretty surprising. I am off to order the non minty version if they still offer those.
customer_reviews.author: Indiana

customer_reviews.title: My dog hates the taste of this
customer_reviews.text: See that picture? That's my dog giving me the stank eye, after I tried to give him this stuff... worse yet? He wouldnt touch his food, when I mixed this in. Nope.... cant get him to try it, ever again.
customer_reviews.author: robinfeist

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by my vet
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by my vet for the high amounts of EPA and DHA, I just didn't realize it was mint flavored. What dog likes mint? My dogs will normally eat a fish oil capsule, no problem, but not these. For now I give it to them disguised in peanut butter. It would be great if we had the option to choose mint or regular...
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Lindstrom

customer_reviews.title: Smells Horrible!!!
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, it's my fault for not reading the details more thoroughly. I didn't realize that this fish oil is spearmint flavored. The smell is absolutely horrible. I can't stand the smell. Then my dogs breathe smells the same. I don't know if I can return it or not, but I'm going to see. Be warned of the smell!!!
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them!
customer_reviews.text: When I first started giving my dog the softgel caps she just snarfed them down with her food. Then one day I saw her take the cap out of the bowl of food and take it to the bedroom. Dang, I thought she was going to refuse to eat it. But no, she delicately bit into it, swallowed it down and went back to her food. Now she does that every day-a little taste treat apparently.
customer_reviews.author: Debora Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Vet Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This item came highly recommended by our vet. We were concerned and wanted to be proactive in keeping our Corgi healthy. He would not take this supplement alone and would eat around it in his food; however, a little bit of peanut butter made it much more palatable for our boy!
customer_reviews.author: JetterSays...

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We rescued our lil mini Dachshund earlier this year. We noticed right away that his ears were very dry on the ends and that the hair on the ears was falling out. After doing some tests our vet thought it was a dermatological issue of some kind, and recommended we try Welactin. It took about a month to see results, but once it kicked in our lil guy has been so much better! All of the dryness is gone and his hair grew back. As an added bonus, his hair is softer and shinier all over now! Love this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Chantel Michelle Todd

customer_reviews.title: Really great for our dog
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended this to us for our dog because he has some bad legs and joints. It's really easy to give it to him in the capsule format - he eats it happily. It smells decent - the peppermint prevents it from smelling like fish - and it seems to be helping his legs feel better. We're really happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Mary HTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: My dog started to have dry, flaky skin as she got older and the vet recommended we try an omega-3 supplement for her. We've been using this ever since and her dry skin has resolved almost completely. She eats the capsules without a problem, and I feel great knowing I'm giving her something to help her stay healthy. If you're looking for an omega-3 supplement for your dog, this brand is an excellent choice!
customer_reviews.author: ATop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Makes your dogs coat super soft!!
customer_reviews.text: I give both of my dogs these everyday. They make their coats very soft and I think it helped my dogs allergy rash prone feet from getting as bad this summer! And I never thought about it until now but I don't think they make their breath smell bad that I've noticed!
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: Caused diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: Our dog has a partial acl tear and we are trying conservative treatment before resorting to surgery. These gave our dog very bad diarrhea, even at a half dose. We discontinued them, and her bm are back to normal. These may work for some dogs, but ours did not respond well to them.
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: More harm than good
customer_reviews.text: I tried this as an anti-itch relief and my Golden Retriever mix. She seemed to enjoy the flavor and the shape didn’t seem to bother her. However, I saw her itching more than she was before taking this product. I guess it doesn’t work for all dogs.
customer_reviews.author: P. Udell

customer_reviews.title: Grear prior and post hip surgeries in your pets and for everything
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for my 4 Dogs and kitty but now the Orthopedics and Neuro say the new dosage required is Fish Oil 2200mg it can be purchased at Costco large bottle of 1000mg 400ct and still use the 1 Welactin Nutramax 300mg. To give to all breeds.
customer_reviews.author: Deepblue

customer_reviews.title: Perfect find for our dogs
customer_reviews.text: The vet recommended this brand, but in the liquid drops, which I didn't want to mess with on a daily basis. So I found these, which are awesome! Our dogs take them as a treat, and no fishy smell at all!
customer_reviews.author: K. Heller

customer_reviews.title: Our vet recommended these fish oil caplets for our 12-year-old dog
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended these fish oil caplets for our 12-year-old dog, to find a more natural remedy for some joint stiffness she is experiencing. After reading up on them, we also began giving them to our 2-year-old dog. At this time, we also give the 12-year-old a non-steroid anti-inflammatory med. The vet said that eventually we may not need to use the medication except on super-active days, but for now, she is on both.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Crafts

customer_reviews.title: Okay - wish there was as liquid dispenser product available
customer_reviews.text: We give this to our lab regularly but he won't eat the gel caps. We have to poke a hole i them and empty over the food which works but is a pain. Wish there was a pump or liquid dispenser option for this product.
customer_reviews.author: jjats

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Helps keep my dogs' coats shiny and helps with their allergies. I can give it to one of my dogs as a treat, but the other doesn't like the texture. It's easy enough to hide in their daily food.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: value
customer_reviews.text: they are easy to get into the dogs mouth and push down his throat, but If they were smaller it would be easier, especially since he has to have 3 a day. They have helped his skin
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Holden

customer_reviews.title: great for our dogs coat
customer_reviews.text: We have been using Welactin for a few years now. We have dog that we rescued that had a rough life previous to us and these have helped bring her coat back to life as well as keeping our boxer's coat looking great. We started with the liquid product which worked great but these are just so much easier to toss in with their food with out the mess. Check with your vet before giving your dog anything.
customer_reviews.author: Regan Burford

customer_reviews.title: Recommended By My Vet
customer_reviews.text: I use Welactin for the skin health of my dog. I feel it is better than OTC oil supplements made for humans, as it specifically designed for canines. My vet also recommended this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Ondeka

customer_reviews.title: and recommended we try these
customer_reviews.text: We use these for my diabetic dog who also has somewhat high cholesterol. Her vet believed this could contribute to higher blood sugars, and recommended we try these. We have been using these for about 4 years and have helped a lot with blood sugar regulation for our furbaby :P
customer_reviews.author: Krw

customer_reviews.title: Noticeable improvements after a week
customer_reviews.text: The Welactin does wonders for my lab's skin and hair. I noticed a shiny coat and less skin irritation after a week of using. I recommend giving this product a try if your dog constantly itches and its coat is not shiny.
customer_reviews.author: Knuckles89

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a partially torn cruciate ligament. Vet recommended this until he needs surgery and we have used it ever since! He seems to move a lot better with it! We cover them in peanut butter and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Not a success
customer_reviews.text: Well *I* don't hate it, but my dog does. Honestly, who started the rumor that dogs like MINT?? An mine will not trust a gelcap either. We've persevered with opening them, but I don't recommend it OR this item. We'll go back to the liquid, which has helped our dog considerably.
customer_reviews.author: Trish of ME

customer_reviews.title: Have used this for years
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended this for our Golden Retriever, who was basically born with arthritis. Works very well and seems to help her stay active. I put it in with her food and she eats it right up. Doesn’t stink at all.
customer_reviews.author: ABSACTO

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it and it works
customer_reviews.text: Great for older or younger dogs - I have a 12 and 1.5 yr old Boxers. Their coats look nice and good for overall health. My dogs get 3 a day and they have it mixed in their breakfast. They say 4 paws up, they are yummy!
customer_reviews.author: Haylee May

customer_reviews.title: Dog threw up every time I gave this to her
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old female French Bulldog threw up every time I gave this to her. I tried multiple times and took a break in between for about 5 days in-between each time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: dog's don't like mint!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dog obviously and he does not like mint! why would you flavor mint anyways?? i bought 3 of these and would send them all back.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: my shepherd's coat stating looking dull. Did not work for her
customer_reviews.text: In 5 days on it, my shepherd's coat stating looking dull. Did not work for her, I went back to Grizzley salmon oil. Her coat has always been super on that. I gave the bottles to a friend. .
customer_reviews.author: Nancy M. Makowski

customer_reviews.title: As a DVM, this is my go-to recommendation for ...
customer_reviews.text: As a DVM, this is my go-to recommendation for fish oil. My pup loves these, and inhales them with her dinner. Has been a huge help in managing her skin allergies, and as an agility dog, I'll give her any supplement that will help protect her joints and heart.
customer_reviews.author: anicole

customer_reviews.title: Excellent vitamin for your dog
customer_reviews.text: It should just be the basic vitamin you give your dogs. Improves their skin and coat and general well being. Smells nice and minty too.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Makes worlds a difference
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this product after my 7 year old mutt was shedding uncontrollably to the point where tuffs of his hair were falling out. This product has made all the difference. He doesn’t seem to mind it and eats it with his food. He no longer is loosing his hair anymore then his typical shed.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marie

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: I can't adequately review the flavor as these are for my dog but he takes them so i guess that's worth 5 stars? lol. They have really helped his skin issues (alopecia).
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Works great :) Dog loves the taste.
customer_reviews.text: My dog has skin conditions and calcification in her neck and spine. She is actually on prescription meds as well but this helps her just a little bit more :). Vet recommended. I just pop open the pill and mix it with her food once a day. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Kyoki

customer_reviews.title: Running out of hair
customer_reviews.text: My dog chomps these right down. We have found few things she doesn't eat though Vet suggested walactin for my dogs hair loss. Hopefully this helps, she's running out of hair and winter is coming!
customer_reviews.author: The Guti's

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Surgery At This Time
customer_reviews.text: Our lab has a torn meniscus and this sure is helping him. Limping very little. Back to running ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Poppanine

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs coat has never been shinier and healthier! My dog has very course hair and it gets dry, flaky & always itchy. This was actually recommended by my vet & it’s worked so well! We had neighbors comment on his coat only a week after starting. I’ll continue to buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Sob

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this product!
customer_reviews.text: It took a few weeks to get my dog used to this fish-oil capsules, but now she eats them eagerly. Surprisingly, the mint flavor added to the gelatin really does mask the fishy odor. Fish oil supplements for humans have not been shown to be particularly effective, and the same limitation may apply to canines. But I can't see any harm in this supplementation, and I hope this omega 3s in this formulation may help with my elderly doggie's arthritis. I plan to re-order this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sognatrice

customer_reviews.title: Great daily supplement
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Our vet recommended we add them as a daily supplement. Her skin and coat are very healthy. She looks excellent.
customer_reviews.author: George Naftzinger

customer_reviews.title: great for coat
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been taking these for a few months and he eats them like a treat with no issue. They have helped his skin and he has terrible allergies and skin issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Overall this products deserves 5 stars as I have used the oil in the past and has changed my dogs life in a great way!
customer_reviews.text: Only 3 Stars these because the pills are very large and I was hoping for an easier way to distribute to my dogs as they stopped liking the taste of the oil I give them by Well Actin. Overall this products deserves 5 stars as I have used the oil in the past and has changed my dogs life in a great way!
customer_reviews.author: Doreen Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Was recommended by a veterinarian behaviorist. Didn't do much of anything to help our dog.
customer_reviews.author: Revi M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the coat
customer_reviews.text: Helped our dog's patchy hair problem due to thyroid issue. Initially she ate them like treats. By the end of the bottle, we had to make sure to put them in with her food. Regardless, the helped her coat considerably.
customer_reviews.author: Deer HunterTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for itchy & dry skin
customer_reviews.text: My vet put my cockapoo on it along with an antihistamine after an allergy laden Spring as a 2 yr old puppy. We stopped the antihistamine after 2 wks and she's been on this fish oil ever since. That was 3 1/2 yrs ago. Now her sister, also a cockapoo, takes it, too. Their skin is great, never itchy or flaky, hair is soft & silky and their eyes are bright. Lots of oodles have skin sensitivities, fish oil is great and no side effects. I used to put it in her mouth, but she quickly got wise. Now it's mixed in with their wet food and they take it no problem. No oily mess or fishy smelling faces.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Doggie is looking very good.
customer_reviews.text: My dog seems to be doing well with this supplement along with other helpful supplements. Hair and skin are fine. There is a liquid form which is good for dogs that don't meet the exact size requirement for either one, two or three, etc. The liquid is sort of messy but more accurate in dosage.
customer_reviews.author: rain

customer_reviews.title: 5 year old golden retriever is doing great since we started giving her these tablets
customer_reviews.text: My 12.5 year old golden retriever is doing great since we started giving her these tablets. She loves them. Our vet recommended them. Made a huge difference, no more limping. She is back to her old self.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara S.

customer_reviews.title: ... was having itchy skin and dandruff and my vet recommended this supplement
customer_reviews.text: I started giving these to my lab because she was having itchy skin and dandruff and my vet recommended this supplement. Within a week of giving her 2 pills daily the dandruff started to disappear and she was scratching a lot less. She doesn't mind taking it either. Sometimes I just toss it to her and other times I just put it in her food. Either way she swallows it quickly. I now just give her 1 a day and her coat is shiny and healthy. Love this!
customer_reviews.author: german chick

customer_reviews.title: Not for big dogs you have to give them too many
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend these due to you have to give a big dog so many. Wasted my money
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Started giving this to our pup who was always scratching, biting, and licking herself. Symptoms cleared up fast.
customer_reviews.author: Brett J

customer_reviews.title: Great fish oil for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I have been using this for my dog (20 lb. shih tzu) for over three years, and I think it's very beneficial for him. The EPA/DHA ratio is good, not too high for his weight, nor too low to do any good. When I ran out of this recently and bought a lower dose fish oil for the interim until this arrived, I noticed he was a bit more sluggish, and his skin was not as in good shape. I would recommend this product for anyone with a small dog.
customer_reviews.author: M. M.

customer_reviews.title: Shiny dog coat
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended by a dog groomer 3 years ago. Been using them ever since. Seem to make our dog's coats shiny and I have to believe they are good for the dog's health.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We could not be happier with this product
customer_reviews.text: My 9 yr old Pomeraniam was starting to have trouble jumping up on furniture & begging for treats off hind legs! Also his skin was becoming very dry! After my Vet suggested we put him on Nutramax fish oil for his issues, we decided to give it a try. Within a wk there was a noticeable deference in our dogs ability to jump & increased energy level! His skin and hair also became very soft and new baby skin appeared! Seriously! We could not be happier with this product! Also the other added benefits to his heart and other organs! It is also very reasonably priced!!! A must for any pet owner!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was recommended by our vet for dry coat and some dermatitis
customer_reviews.text: Was recommended by our vet for dry coat and some dermatitis. Dogs now think they are treats. No detectable fish odor after consumption. Coats of dogs has improved considerably. Not sure if I can attribute this to the pills but our dog seems to have less discomfort when jumping. Maybe from anti inflammatory properties? Will continue to give to our dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Meyerlem

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for my dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I like the capsules better than the liquid form. Easier for the dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Shell

customer_reviews.title: Didn't live up to all the positive reviews
customer_reviews.text: I have a pit/black lab mix who is constantly scratching to the point that he almost always has a couple scabs on his neck area. This product was recommended by a new vet I tried, as I previously was giving my dog Eicosacaps and they weren't doing anything to help with the itching. Based on so many positive reviews from other people, I was expecting a lot more from this supplement. I have been giving it to my dog for about 2 weeks now and have seen no results whatsoever. I doubt I will re-order this. Guess it might be time to finally do the skin testing that the vet mentioned...
customer_reviews.author: Lindley

customer_reviews.title: Incredible impact on our dog's coat!
customer_reviews.text: These gels completely transformed our Basset Hound/Bulldog mix's. When we adopted her, she had bald spots and her coat was pretty wirey. After 3-4 months, her coat completely transformed - her coat is fully grown in and we now get nonstop coats on how shiny and soft she is. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: Keeps coats soft and shiny
customer_reviews.text: Been using this product for 6 years to keep my two shih tzus' coats soft and shiny.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Kingsbury

customer_reviews.title: Really helped with dry coat issues
customer_reviews.text: Most of my dogs love these and they gobble them down. I like the ease of throwing a pill in their meals. However, I had to go to the liquid form for my one picky eater, the rest still get the capsules. All the dogs' skin and coats have greatly improved once I started using Welactin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why the mint??
customer_reviews.text: My dog has no problem eating the oil on its own or on his food, but he wont touch the mint "flavored" gel caps or the oil (which also smells like mint) even if I squeeze it out of the caps and mix it into peanut butter. So disappointing! I would try the liquid version but read awful reviews about what a mess that bottle/spoon is. Still looking for the pump-bottle, that would be ideal.
customer_reviews.author: NYShopper105

customer_reviews.title: dog's fur
customer_reviews.text: Welactin gives my dog the smoothest and shiniest coat ever.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is so much easier to use than the oil. My 16lb dog is handling it well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Nurtramax Canine Omega Capsules
customer_reviews.text: The fish smell turned my dog away even though I tried to masked the smell with peanut butter, etc. The capsule was never punctured, but the fish smell was really strong for a 20 lb smaller dog.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry M.

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I've been giving these vitamins to my dog for a few years now and these have really helped his coat stay healthy. Definitely recommend these if your dog has dry skin, suffers from dandruff or scratches a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great for my dog
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great for my dog. Keeping him healthy and helps with his scratching.
customer_reviews.author: SoBaud

customer_reviews.title: I've seen such a difference in my 11 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: I've seen such a difference in my 11 year old boxer! She has way more energy and less limping. I wish they would have a different flavor because she'll only eat them with peanut butter or cheese.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Good value for your money and good for pet’s health.
customer_reviews.text: Helps with my dogs arthritis and allergies. Been using this for years.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rangel

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My Pyr seems to like these with no issues. No belching or gut issues. After a couple of weeks his skin and coat are improving.
customer_reviews.author: NormansMom

customer_reviews.title: Just had her at the vet for her annual checkup and her heart and lungs were great. She still has plenty of play left in ...
customer_reviews.text: Our pet seems much healthier right now using them. Just had her at the vet for her annual checkup and her heart and lungs were great. She still has plenty of play left in her even at 12.5 years of age.
customer_reviews.author: Larry DeMonet

customer_reviews.title: Taste Great!  (I suppose)
customer_reviews.text: Corgi boy (b. 2007?) takes his Omega 3 every morning. Keeps him chasing squirrels and barking at the pizza delivery person.
customer_reviews.author: Sr Happy Popi

customer_reviews.title: My dog won’t eat them
customer_reviews.text: My dog hates these so I have to break open the capsules to put them in his food. I purchased the liquid form which is way easier. My sister’s dogs love them, though!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Welactin supplements for skin and coat
customer_reviews.text: All three of my dogs love these capsules and it makes their breath smell like peppermint
customer_reviews.author: Sandyfeet

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work great!
customer_reviews.text: My bulldog seemed to have an allergy problem of some sort. Every evening his muzzle would get bright pink. I read other reviews for this product and decided to try it. Since we've been giving him Welactin it has stopped and he has had no allergy problems of any kind. Started giving it to our other bulldog, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Postms

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job for both of my dogs
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job for both of my dogs. Noticed the biggest difference with my greyhound who had SUPER dry skin. My greyhound will eat these up quite happily as is, but my dachshund needs a pill pocket to eat them without complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Hill

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Love this and We do Too
customer_reviews.text: This is yet another example of a good product recommended by our Veterinarian to improve the health of our dogs. The dogs love the product and act like it is a treat and not a health product. When we purchased it at the Vet, we paid a lot for it. After checking with Amazon.com, we found the product at less than half the price for more product. It is the same product in the same packaging and arrived on time when ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Cogator

customer_reviews.title: They are large pills for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: It says ok for "small" dogs, but they're pretty big pills. Fine for a 13lb dog but smaller may be an issue. You will need to put in food or peanut butter as they are not flavored.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure they work, but my dogs won't take them, so I have to puncture and place on food... then fish breath.
customer_reviews.text: Dogs won't eat them, so I have to puncture the capsule and squeeze onto their food. Then their beards smell like fish. Hiding it in a pill pocket doesn't work either, and I'm not paying more for those. I"m sure they work well for some dogs, just not mine. I shifted to the Pet-MD chews.
customer_reviews.author: David L.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works well to relieve dry, flaky coat
customer_reviews.text: I've used regular fish oil capsules without much evident success so thought I'd try this based on other reviews here. It is an easy product to administer. The dogs don't spit it out like the did the other fish oil capsules. That may be because these are smaller and can be swallowed more easily, without the dog feeling the need to chew it. One sheltie particularly has a dry coat and this has cut down on scratching and flaking a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Southern belle

customer_reviews.title: This was suggested by my Vet for my two 11 ...
customer_reviews.text: This was suggested by my Vet for my two 11 year old Lab mixes. They both had ACL surgery’s . Really seems to help their joints and mobility
customer_reviews.author: a customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by my vet
customer_reviews.text: This makes such a difference in my dog’s coat. She doesn’t shed as much, and her coat is super shiny. Her skin looks healthy, and she thinks they are treats. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa F.

customer_reviews.title: A very useful product to promote health in dogs
customer_reviews.text: My almost 12 year old sheltie still competes at the highest levels of agility after a long illustrious career. She depends on her Welactin 3 cap every day to help keep her in awesome shape. It is a great product that we have used since she was about 2 years old and will continue to use as long as she lives. Amazon.com is a great place to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: agility addict

customer_reviews.title: Large capsules
customer_reviews.text: I cover them with cream chesee and my chi will swallow them
customer_reviews.author: Mystic480

customer_reviews.title: Was recommended by our vet
customer_reviews.text: Was recommended by our vet, especially for my older girl to help with her issues. And it really works. Her coat began to shine again. My 2 amstaff also eat it with pleasure and really love it. It is like sweets for them. I like also minty taste, my dogs don't have fishy breath after eating. And the price is best, thank you Amazon.com!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can make it easier to give fish oil to your pet
customer_reviews.text: This brand was recommended by my vet. While I had been using some others, this brand has a coating on the capsules which some dogs will love. Mine did for a while and then seemed to grow tired of it for some reason. However, it's still a good product with easy to figure out dosage, and fish oil in general has helped my dog a lot with allergies.
customer_reviews.author: EG

product_meta.title: Welactin Omega-3 Skin and Coat Support, 120 Softgels
product_meta.description: Welactin Canine provides a rich source of omega-3 fatty acids from wild-caught, cold-water fish to support healthy skin and a shiny coat, heart health, kidney health, brain health, immune health, and vision.
feature_bullets: RICH SOURCE OF EPA and DHA: Welactin provides a rich source of beneficial long-chain omega-3 fatty acids EPA and DHA from wild-caught, cold-water fish
MINIMIZE FISHY BREATH: Made with peppermint oil to help minimize doggy breath
DERIVED FROM SMALL COLD-WATER FISH: The fish oil found in Welactin is derived from small cold-water fish, which typically have less accumulation of toxins than larger cold-water fish
QUALITY TESTED: Welactin is quality tested for contaminants and heavy metals
